function_phrase: Don’t get hung up on the numbers—
main_point: The professor explains Paleomagnetism and geomagnetic reversals and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes mantle convection (a process) from lithosphere (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving subduction and karst.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a conference anecdote to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for seismic wave shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
